alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Jones; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 6:08PM EDT until May 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following counties, Duplin, Jones and Lenoir. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing and will be worsened by additional rainfall in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kinston, Warsaw, La Grange, Mount Olive, Grifton, Deep Run, Bowdens, Beautancus, Institute, Dawson, Graingers, Wyse Fork, Albertson, Kinston Regional Jetport, Faison, Calypso and Sandy Bottom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
